metadata.title: Review: FCIS — Winner in 2016 COCO Segmentation (Instance Segmentation) | by Sik-Ho Tsang | Towards Data Science
metadata.h1: Review: FCIS — Winner in 2016 COCO Segmentation (Instance Segmentation)
metadata.description: In this story, FCIS (Fully Convolutional Instance-aware Semantic Segmentation), by Tsinghua University and Microsoft Research Asia, is reviewed. It is the FIRST fully convolutional end-to-end…

all_paragraphs: In this story, FCIS (Fully Convolutional Instance-aware Semantic Segmentation), by Tsinghua University and Microsoft Research Asia, is reviewed. It is the FIRST fully convolutional end-to-end solution for instance segmentation. By introducing the Position-Sensitive Inside/Outside Score Maps, convolutional representation is fully shared for both detection and segmentation sub-tasks. High accuracy and efficiency are obtained.

Finally, FCIS won the 1st place in 2016 COCO segmentation challenge, outperform the second place entry by 12% in accuracy relatively. It also ranked 2nd in 2016 COCO detection leaderboard at that moment. It was named as Translation-aware Fully Convolutional Instance Segmentation (TA-FCN) initially.

MNC, which won 1st place in 2015 COCO segmentation challenge, takes 1.4s per image where 80% of the time is spent on the last per-ROI step. FCIS only takes 0.24s per image using ResNet-101 (Nvidia K40) which is much faster than that of MNC. You may think that the inference time is still slow, however, COCO segmentation challenge urges for state-of-the-art mAP. Thus, it is already amazing that FCIS boosted the mAP further and won the 1st place while reducing the inference time. Finally, it is published in 2017 CVPR with more than 100 citations. (Sik-Ho Tsang @ Medium)
PhD, Researcher. I share what I learn. :) Linktree: https://linktr.ee/shtsang for Twitter, LinkedIn, etc.
